title: India vs South Africa 1st T20 2015: 4 things you need to know about scenic cricket ground in Dharamsala
text:
India vs South Africa 1st T20 2015: 4 things you need to know about scenic cricket ground in Dharamsala By Aamir Salati on October 2, 2015 at 4:48 PM Comments The ‘Freedom Series’ between India and South Africa finally kicks-off as the two teams take on in the 1st T20I at the awe-inspiring Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala. The stadium provides for a perfect setting of cricket in the lap of nature. Also Read- India vs South Africa T20 series: A look at stats and records between IND & RSA The ground in Dharamsala is no doubt the most scenic one in India. The visitors will love to play at this venue as it offers a good pace and bounce to fast bowlers, which happens to be the strength of the South African team. Also Check- Full coverage of India vs South Africa 2015 As two teams get set for a riveting game of cricket, we could not resist and here we are with some interesting details about the scenic cricket ground. Location- The ground is situated at an altitude over 1400m above sea level. The stadium is nearby to Dauladhar hill-range. The mountains are visible from the venue itself. Needless to say, the mountainous background makes for a soothing view. First international match- In 2013 the stadium hosted its first international match. The one-day International (ODI) was played between India and the visiting England side, which the host lost. The ground has hosted just two ODIs thus far. The second game was played in 2014 between India and West Indies and hosts emerged as winners this time. First T20- The match between India and South Africa will be the first T20I played at the venue. The stadium has hosted few Indian Premier League (IPL) matches as well. First to use rye grass- According to espncricinfo, the stadium is the first in India to use winter rye grass. This type of grass helps the field to stay greener even when temperatures fall below 10 degrees Celsius, which usually happens in Autumn and winter season.
